reporter_caption.center: PADGETT v. METROPOLITAN DADE COUNTY, 249 So.2d 741 (Fla.App. 3 Dist. 1971)

caption.center: INMAN PADGETT, AS AN INDIVIDUAL, ET AL., APPELLANTS, v. METROPOLITAN DADE
COUNTY, A POLITICAL SUBDIVISION OF THE STATE OF FLORIDA, APPELLEE.

court.center: District Court of Appeal of Florida, Third District.

opinion.posture: Appeal from the Circuit Court for Dade County; J. Gwynn Parker, Judge.
opinion.attorneys:
Henry G. Simmonite, Miami, and Donald G. MacKenzie, Miami, for appellants.
Stuart L. Simon, County Atty., and St. Julian P. Rosemond, Asst. County Atty., for appellee.
opinion.panel: Before CHARLES CARROLL, HENDRY and BARKDULL, JJ.
opinion.opinion_text: Affirmed on the authority of Dade County v. Epstein, Fla.App. 1966, 181 So.2d 556; City of South Miami v. Alvin, Fla.App. 1966,189 So.2d 386; Dade County v. Wiseheart, Fla.App. 1967, 198 So.2d 94; Metropolitan Dade County v. Kanter, Fla.App. 1967, 200 So.2d 624.Page 742
